intro: Achnodon bellardii, commonly known as the bellard's cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, calcareous soils along streams and in wet meadows. The plant has basal leaves that are pinnately divided, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in racemes. It produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in many regions.
